cambalache-catalog.type_enum: ("GdkAxisUse","GDK_AXIS_DISTANCE","distance",7,"the axis is used for pen/tablet distance information. (Since: 3.22)"), ("GdkAxisUse","GDK_AXIS_IGNORE","ignore",None,"the axis is ignored."), ("GdkAxisUse","GDK_AXIS_LAST","last",10,"a constant equal to the numerically highest axis value."), ("GdkAxisUse","GDK_AXIS_PRESSURE","pressure",3,"the axis is used for pressure information."), ("GdkAxisUse","GDK_AXIS_ROTATION","rotation",8,"the axis is used for pen rotation information. For instance, the 32-bit value 0xffeecc would be stored in memory as 0xcc, 0xee, 0xff, 0x00."), ("GdkByteOrder","GDK_MSB_FIRST","msb-first",1,"The values are stored with the most-significant byte first. For instance, the 32-bit value 0xffeecc would be stored in memory as 0x00, 0xff, 0xee, 0xcc."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_DEVICE_SWITCH","device-switch",8,"crossing because of a device switch (i.e. a mouse taking control of the pointer after a touch device), this event is synthetic as the pointer didn’t leave the window."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_GRAB","grab",1,"crossing because a grab is activated."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_GTK_GRAB","gtk-grab",3,"crossing because a GTK+ grab is activated."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_GTK_UNGRAB","gtk-ungrab",4,"crossing because a GTK+ grab is deactivated."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_NORMAL","normal",None,"crossing because of pointer motion."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_STATE_CHANGED","state-changed",5,"crossing because a GTK+ widget changed state (e.g. sensitivity)."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_TOUCH_BEGIN","touch-begin",6,"crossing because a touch sequence has begun, this event is synthetic as the pointer might have not left the window."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_TOUCH_END","touch-end",7,"crossing because a touch sequence has ended, this event is synthetic as the pointer might have not left the window."), ("GdkCrossingMode","GDK_CROSSING_UNGRAB","ungrab",2,"crossing because a grab is deactivated."), ("GdkCursorType","GDK_ARROW","arrow",2,"![](arrow.png)"), ("GdkCursorType","GDK_BASED_ARROW_DOWN","based-arrow-down",4,"![](based_arrow_down.png)"), ("GdkCursorType","GDK_BASED_ARROW_UP","based-arrow-up",6,"![](based_arrow_up.png)"), ("GdkCursorType","GDK_BLANK_CURSOR","blank-cursor",-2,"Blank cursor. Note that each click also generates a %GDK_BUTTON_PRESS event."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_3BUTTON_PRESS","3button-press",6,"a mouse button has been clicked 3 times in a short period of time. Note that each click also generates a %GDK_BUTTON_PRESS event."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_BUTTON_PRESS","button-press",4,"a mouse button has been pressed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_BUTTON_RELEASE","button-release",7,"a mouse button has been released."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_CLIENT_EVENT","client-event",28,"a message has been received from another application."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_CONFIGURE","configure",13,"the size, position or stacking order of the window has changed. Note that GTK+ discards these events for %GDK_WINDOW_CHILD windows."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DAMAGE","damage",36,"the content of the window has been changed. This event type was added in 2.14."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DELETE","delete",None,"the window manager has requested that the toplevel window be hidden or destroyed, usually when the user clicks on a special icon in the title bar."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DESTROY","destroy",1,"the window has been destroyed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DOUBLE_BUTTON_PRESS","double-button-press",5,"alias for %GDK_2BUTTON_PRESS, added in 3.6."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DRAG_ENTER","drag-enter",22,"the mouse has entered the window while a drag is in progress."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DRAG_LEAVE","drag-leave",23,"the mouse has left the window while a drag is in progress."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DRAG_MOTION","drag-motion",24,"the mouse has moved in the window while a drag is in progress."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DRAG_STATUS","drag-status",25,"the status of the drag operation initiated by the window has changed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DROP_FINISHED","drop-finished",27,"the drop operation initiated by the window has completed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_DROP_START","drop-start",26,"a drop operation onto the window has started."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_ENTER_NOTIFY","enter-notify",10,"the pointer has entered the window."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_EVENT_LAST","event-last",48,"marks the end of the GdkEventType enumeration. Added in 2.18"), ("GdkEventType","GDK_EXPOSE","expose",2,"all or part of the window has become visible and needs to be redrawn."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_FOCUS_CHANGE","focus-change",12,"the keyboard focus has entered or left the window."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_GRAB_BROKEN","grab-broken",35,"a pointer or keyboard grab was broken. This event type was added in 2.8."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_KEY_PRESS","key-press",8,"a key has been pressed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_KEY_RELEASE","key-release",9,"a key has been released."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_LEAVE_NOTIFY","leave-notify",11,"the pointer has left the window."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_MAP","map",14,"the window has been mapped."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_MOTION_NOTIFY","motion-notify",3,"the pointer (usually a mouse) has moved."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_NOTHING","nothing",-1,"a special code to indicate a null event."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_OWNER_CHANGE","owner-change",34,"the owner of a selection has changed. This event type was added in 2.6"), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PAD_BUTTON_PRESS","pad-button-press",43,"A tablet pad button press event. This event type was added in 3.22."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PAD_BUTTON_RELEASE","pad-button-release",44,"A tablet pad button release event. This event type was added in 3.22."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PAD_GROUP_MODE","pad-group-mode",47,"A tablet pad group mode change. This event type was added in 3.22."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PAD_RING","pad-ring",45,"A tablet pad axis event from a \"ring\". This event type was added in 3.22."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PAD_STRIP","pad-strip",46,"A tablet pad axis event from a \"strip\". This event type was added in 3.22."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PROPERTY_NOTIFY","property-notify",16,"a property on the window has been changed or deleted."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PROXIMITY_IN","proximity-in",20,"an input device has moved into contact with a sensing surface (e.g. a touchscreen or graphics tablet)."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_PROXIMITY_OUT","proximity-out",21,"an input device has moved out of contact with a sensing surface."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_SCROLL","scroll",31,"the scroll wheel was turned"), ("GdkEventType","GDK_SELECTION_CLEAR","selection-clear",17,"the application has lost ownership of a selection."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_SELECTION_NOTIFY","selection-notify",19,"a selection has been received."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_SELECTION_REQUEST","selection-request",18,"another application has requested a selection."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_SETTING","setting",33,"a setting has been modified."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCHPAD_PINCH","touchpad-pinch",42,"A touchpad pinch gesture event, the current state is determined by its phase field. This event type was added in 3.18."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCHPAD_SWIPE","touchpad-swipe",41,"A touchpad swipe gesture event, the current state is determined by its phase field. This event type was added in 3.18."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCH_BEGIN","touch-begin",37,"A new touch event sequence has just started. This event type was added in 3.4."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCH_CANCEL","touch-cancel",40,"A touch event sequence has been canceled. This event type was added in 3.4."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCH_END","touch-end",39,"A touch event sequence has finished. This event type was added in 3.4."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TOUCH_UPDATE","touch-update",38,"A touch event sequence has been updated. This event type was added in 3.4."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_TRIPLE_BUTTON_PRESS","triple-button-press",6,"alias for %GDK_3BUTTON_PRESS, added in 3.6."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_UNMAP","unmap",15,"the window has been unmapped."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_VISIBILITY_NOTIFY","visibility-notify",29,"the window visibility status has changed."), ("GdkEventType","GDK_WINDOW_STATE","window-state",32,"the state of a window has changed. See #GdkWindowState for the possible window states"), ("GdkFilterReturn","GDK_FILTER_CONTINUE","continue",None,"event not handled, continue processing."), ("GdkFilterReturn","GDK_FILTER_REMOVE","remove",2,"event handled, terminate processing."), ("GdkFilterReturn","GDK_FILTER_TRANSLATE","translate",1,"native event translated into a GDK event and stored in the `event` structure that was passed in."), ("GdkFullscreenMode","GDK_FULLSCREEN_ON_ALL_MONITORS","all-monitors",1,"Span across all monitors when fullscreen."), ("GdkFullscreenMode","GDK_FULLSCREEN_ON_CURRENT_MONITOR","current-monitor",None,"Fullscreen on current monitor only."), ("GdkGLError","GDK_GL_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE","not-available",None,"OpenGL support is not available"), ("GdkGLError","GDK_GL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT","unsupported-format",1,"The requested visual format is not supported"), ("GdkGLError","GDK_GL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PROFILE","unsupported-profile",2,"The requested profile is not supported"), ("GdkGrabOwnership","GDK_OWNERSHIP_APPLICATION","application",2,"Other devices’ events are blocked for the whole application."), ("GdkGrabOwnership","GDK_OWNERSHIP_NONE","none",None,"All other devices’ events are allowed."), ("GdkGrabOwnership","GDK_OWNERSHIP_WINDOW","window",1,"Other devices’ events are blocked for the grab window."), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_ALREADY_GRABBED","already-grabbed",1,"the resource is actively grabbed by another client."), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_FAILED","failed",5,"the grab failed for some other reason. Since 3.16"), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_FROZEN","frozen",4,"the resource is frozen by an active grab of another client."), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_INVALID_TIME","invalid-time",2,"the resource was grabbed more recently than the specified time."), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_NOT_VIEWABLE","not-viewable",3,"the grab window or the @confine_to window are not viewable."), ("GdkGrabStatus","GDK_GRAB_SUCCESS","success",None,"the resource was successfully grabbed."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_CENTER","center",5,"the reference point is at the center of the window."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_EAST","east",6,"the reference point is at the middle of the right edge."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH","north",2,"the reference point is in the middle of the top edge."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_EAST","north-east",3,"the reference point is at the top right corner."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_NORTH_WEST","north-west",1,"the reference point is at the top left corner."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH","south",8,"the reference point is at the middle of the lower edge."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH_EAST","south-east",9,"the reference point is at the lower right corner."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_SOUTH_WEST","south-west",7,"the reference point is at the lower left corner."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_STATIC","static",10,"the reference point is at the top left corner of the window itself, ignoring window manager decorations."), ("GdkGravity","GDK_GRAVITY_WEST","west",4,"the reference point is at the middle of the left edge."), ("GdkInputMode","GDK_MODE_DISABLED","disabled",None,"the device is disabled and will not report any events."), ("GdkInputMode","GDK_MODE_SCREEN","screen",1,"the device is enabled. The device’s coordinate space maps to the entire screen."), ("GdkInputMode","GDK_MODE_WINDOW","window",2,"the device is enabled. The device’s coordinate space is mapped to a single window. The manner in which this window is chosen is undefined, but it will typically be the same way in which the focus window for key events is determined."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_CURSOR","cursor",3,"the device is a graphics tablet “puck” or similar device."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_ERASER","eraser",2,"the device is an eraser. Typically, this would be the other end of a stylus on a graphics tablet."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_KEYBOARD","keyboard",4,"the device is a keyboard."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_MOUSE","mouse",None,"the device is a mouse. (This will be reported for the core pointer, even if it is something else, such as a trackball.)"), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_PEN","pen",1,"the device is a stylus of a graphics tablet or similar device."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_TABLET_PAD","tablet-pad",8,"the device is a \"pad\", a collection of buttons, rings and strips found in drawing tablets. This device type has been added in 3.22."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHPAD","touchpad",6,"the device is an indirect touch device, such as a touchpad. This device type has been added in 3.4."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN","touchscreen",5,"the device is a direct-input touch device, such as a touchscreen or tablet. This device type has been added in 3.4."), ("GdkInputSource","GDK_SOURCE_TRACKPOINT","trackpoint",7,"the device is a trackpoint. This device type has been added in 3.22"), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_CONTEXT_MENU","context-menu",1,"the modifier used to invoke context menus. Note that mouse button 3 always triggers context menus. When this modifier is not 0, it additionally triggers context menus when used with mouse button 1."), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_DEFAULT_MOD_MASK","default-mod-mask",6,"The set of modifier masks accepted as modifiers in accelerators. Needed because Command is mapped to MOD2 on OSX, which is widely used, but on X11 MOD2 is NumLock and using that for a mod key is problematic at best. Ref: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=736125."), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_EXTEND_SELECTION","extend-selection",2,"the modifier used to extend selections using `modifier`-click or `modifier`-cursor-key"), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_MODIFY_SELECTION","modify-selection",3,"the modifier used to modify selections, which in most cases means toggling the clicked item into or out of the selection."), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_NO_TEXT_INPUT","no-text-input",4,"when any of these modifiers is pressed, the key event cannot produce a symbol directly. This is meant to be used for input methods, and for use cases like typeahead search."), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_PRIMARY_ACCELERATOR","primary-accelerator",None,"the primary modifier used to invoke menu accelerators."), ("GdkModifierIntent","GDK_MODIFIER_INTENT_SHIFT_GROUP","shift-group",5,"the modifier that switches between keyboard groups (AltGr on X11/Windows and Option/Alt on OS X)."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_ANCESTOR","ancestor",None,"the window is entered from an ancestor or left towards an ancestor."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_INFERIOR","inferior",2,"the window is entered from an inferior or left towards an inferior."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR","nonlinear",3,"the window is entered from or left towards a window which is neither an ancestor nor an inferior."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_NONLINEAR_VIRTUAL","nonlinear-virtual",4,"the pointer moves between two windows which are not ancestors of each other and the window is part of the ancestor chain between one of these windows and their least common ancestor."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_UNKNOWN","unknown",5,"an unknown type of enter/leave event occurred."), ("GdkNotifyType","GDK_NOTIFY_VIRTUAL","virtual",1,"the pointer moves between an ancestor and an inferior of the window."), ("GdkOwnerChange","GDK_OWNER_CHANGE_CLOSE","close",2,"the client was
